intro: Secamone kunstleri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, orange-red berries that contain the seeds. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Secamone kunstleri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
